Package mmj.mmio

Class Statementizer

java.lang.Object
mmj.mmio.Statementizer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AutoCloseable
public class Statementizer extends Object implements Closeable
Load input MetaMath tokens for a single Metamath statement into a "work" structure, SrcStmt.

(This is actually a somewhat inefficient intermediate step on the way to loading the source into memory, but is done this way to simplify the main code and to improve testability.)

See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getTitleIfApplicable

      public static String getTitleIfApplicable(String s, String idString)
      Retrieves Chapter or Section title from a Comment String based on an identifying pair of characters.
      Parameters:
      s - String containing Metamath Comment.
      idString - identifying string of Chapter or Section title.
      Returns:
      Title of Chapter or Section, or null if the Comment does not match the search criteria.

    • bypassWhitespace

      public static int bypassWhitespace(String s, int i)
      Bypasses Metamath whitespace in a String.
      Parameters:
      s - String containing Metamath characters.
      i - index within String marking beginning of scan for whitespace.
      Returns:
      index of first non-whitespace character or position beyond the end of the input String.

    • bypassNonWhitespace

      public static int bypassNonWhitespace(String s, int i)
      Bypasses Metamath non-whitespace in a String.
      Parameters:
      s - String containing Metamath characters.
      i - index within String marking beginning of scan for non-whitespace.
      Returns:
      index of first whitespace character or position beyond the end of the input String.

    • isLabelOnProhibitedList

      public static boolean isLabelOnProhibitedList(String s)
      Checks to see if a String is in the list of prohibited Metamath labels.

      See Metamath.pdf specification for the source list.

      Parameters:
      s - String to check against the Prohibited Label list.
      Returns:
      true if string is on the Prohibited Label list, otherwise false.

    • isValidLabel

      public static boolean isValidLabel(String s)
      Checks to see if a String is a valid Metamath label name.
      Parameters:
      s - String to check
      Returns:
      true if string is valid

    • areLabelCharsValid

      public static boolean areLabelCharsValid(String s)
      Checks to see if each character in a String is a valid Metamath character.

      See Metamath.pdf specification for the source list.

      Parameters:
      s - String of characters to check for validity.
      Returns:
      true if every character in the input String is a valid Metamath character.

    • isValidMathSymbol

      public static boolean isValidMathSymbol(String s)
      Checks to see whether or not a String contains only symbols defined in Metamath as valid math symbols.
      Parameters:
      s - input token, should be pre-trimmed.
      Returns:
      true if input string contains only valid Metamath math symbol characters; otherwise false.

    • getStmtNbr

      public int getStmtNbr()
      Return number of last statement parsed.

      Statement number is simply a counter of the SrcStmt processed so far. It is not the same as mmj.lang.MObj.seq.

      Returns:
      stmtNbr

    • bypassErrorStmt

      public void bypassErrorStmt() throws IOException
      Attempts to bypass the current statement in the input Metamath file.

      Bypass is intended to give the next next invocation of getStmt() a good chance of finding a complete statement to parse, thus avoiding multiple error messages caused by a single error.

      Throws:
      IOException - if I/O error

    • setStmtNbr

      public void setStmtNbr(int s) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets statement number of the last statement parsed.

      This may come in handy in conjunction with included files -- construct a new Statementizer for the included file, set the stmtNbr, process, then continue processing with the old Statementizer... after setting its stmtNbr. Or...just use the setTokenizer method to switch Tokenizers! Easy.

      Parameters:
      s - Metamath statement (sequence) number.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if input statement number is less than zero.

    • setTokenizer

      public Tokenizer setTokenizer(Tokenizer t) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Switches the Tokenizer reader in use.

      Intended for use with included MetaMath files ($[ xx.mm $] command.)

      Parameters:
      t - input Tokenizer.
      Returns:
      previous Tokenizer in use.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if input Tokenizer is null.

    • getSourceId

      public String getSourceId()
      Returns the current Source information from the Tokenizer.
      Returns:
      the Source info from the Tokenizer in use.

    • getTokenizer

      public Tokenizer getTokenizer()
      Returns the current Tokenizer.
      Returns:
      the Tokenizer in use.

    • getStmt

      public SrcStmt getStmt() throws MMIOException, IOException
      Return next MetaMath SrcStmt.
      Returns:
      next MetaMath SrcStmt or null if EOF.
      Throws:
      IOException - if I/O error
      MMIOException - if invalid SrcStmt read.
